card.description: Data from the 1994 US census, with income, personal, and job data. Used to predict whether a person's income is over $50,000.

context.potentialUses: Predict whether a person's income is over or under $50,000, based on their education level and age. Demonstrate racial and gender-based income inequality.
context.potentialMisuses: Using this for something like determining whether or not to give someone a loan could be deeply unfair.

type of employment.description: Type of employment: government, private, self.

estimated number of people represented.description: The estimate for how many people in the US this person is representative of.

occupation.description: What they do for a living.

relationship.description: Relationship description of their marital status.

race.description: Race (uses 1994 racial categories which excludes a number of distinctions).

gender.description: Gender (uses 1994 Census options, which are binary).

capital gains.description: Their reported capital gains for the year (these are monetary gains from things like selling stock instead of income from a job).

capital losses.description: Their reported capital losses (for example, if they sold a stock that lost them money).

income.description: Their income: binary for greater than or less than $50,000.
